meanings.definition: To corrupt or seduce someone morally
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to debaucher the hero with promises of power.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to debaucher someone into doing something they know is bad.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp delighted in debauchering the young minds with wild tales.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to debaucher even the purest of intentions.
meanings.sent5: The forbidden fruit debauchered Adam and Eve into a world of sin.

meanings.definition: A person who corrupts or seduces others morally
meanings.sent1: The debaucher was known for leading others astray with his silver tongue.
meanings.sent2: Beware of the debaucher who preys on the innocence of the young.
meanings.sent3: The debaucher at the party was the center of attention with their scandalous stories.
meanings.sent4: In the tale, the debaucher was revealed to be the true villain all along.
meanings.sent5: The debaucher's influence spread like a dark cloud over the once peaceful village.
